Severn Bridge, the.translation[0].defini: a suspension bridge over the River Severn. The name is used by most people to refer to the Second Severn Crossing, the bridge that joins southwest England with South Wales, and is part of the M4 motorway. The original Severn Bridge is now called the M48 Severn Suspension Bridge. It also crosses the river from England into Wales, and is part of the M48 motorway.
